body: $ZIM  ran ipo already back to down low
$ZIM from Q2 report Reaffirmed 2022 Full Year Guidance: Expect to Generate Record Adjusted EBITDA1
of $7.8-$8.2 Billion and Adjusted EBIT of $6.3-$6.7 Billion
if we take the low end of guidance 7.8 billion and spread it out like this we know q1 and q2

based on these numbers if we assume NI and cash flow are the same that means ZIM is generating roughly $.03 a day in cash flow per share and we have roughly 84 days since the last ER thats $2.5 a share cash plus the $32.75 they had already thats over $35 cash per share being conservative and a potential $4.5- $7.7 dividend for the next two Q's I actually hope they do share buy backs in lieu of dividends but in my book this is a no brainer even if they make no money in 2023

body: ZIM Integrated Shipping Services downgraded by TheStreet to d+. https://www.marketbeat.com/r/1821734 $ZIM
$ZIM divy?
ZIM Integrated pays its dividend on the basis of a variable dividend policy
created_at: which limits the company's financial commitments during times of falling shipping rates and profits. By doing this
column3: ZIM Integrated reduces its cash flow risk while offering shareholders upside in the dividend during good times when profits and freight rates are high.

body: However
created_at: the decline in shipping rates in September foreshadows a significant decline in net profits (and dividends) for ZIM Integrated and its shareholders. For that reason
column3: I believe the 80% dividend yield is a backward-looking measure for investors that doesn't accurately reflect changes in the company's net income potential related to a drop in freight rates. The 80% dividend yield is therefore most likely not sustainable and a value trap for investors.

body: $ZIM
ZIM Integrated has very little influence over shipping rates
created_at: which are a function of the strength of the global economy. With the IMF recently down-grading its growth expectations for 2023 and inflation still being a major issue around the world
column3: shipping rates are all but set to come further under pressure. While ZIM Integrated pays its dividend on a variable basis
column4: a downturn in the cargo shipping industry would likely seriously impact the firm's ability to generate profits
column5: which may result not only in lower dividend payments going forward but also in a re-rating of ZIM Integrated's shares.
